text: Nice workaround from the past. Webhooks on an internal property maintained by HubSpot: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Create-a-webhook-for-form-submissions/m-p/271815#:~:text=hs_calculated_form_submissions>

Hi, I’m using the *Python SDK* to get data about `companies` and `deals`. I’m probably missing something, but there’s nothing that connects the two: nothing in `deals` points to what company made that deal - I’d expect there would be something.

I am using
```client.crm.objects.get_all(event_type, properties=properties)```
where `event_type` is either ‘companies’ or ‘deals’, and `properties` are all relevant properties that I’m getting with
```client.crm.properties.core_api.get_all(event_type)```
so that I also have the expanded user-defined ones.

Again, not seeing a field that connects between the two collections.

Any knowledgable savior to the rescue? Thanks!
Other solution is to use a workflow and submit a webhook from in there

Hello, I can see that there is a documentation for sending emails via the contacts page here <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/email/send-and-reply-to-one-to-one-emails>

Is this also available in the API? I can only see marketing side of sending email in the API documentation, and not the one sending emails from contact page. Any help is appreciated
<@U039PUBV59N> this is working perfectly now, thank you for this npm doc and info :slightly_smiling_face:

Hello everyone, Im creating a custom card as part of this "<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/extensions/custom-cards>". I left all the default values and just inserted my developer key and app Id.
However it gives me the error on the image which seems to be related to the properties object, that I cant leave empty either for some reason. The custom card creating with UI lets me not set any.
Any pointers?
I have solved it. The documentation doesnt set it as default but "properties" needs to be an array.

Hello everyone, I’m wondering if anyone can help on `communications`  API? <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/communications>
communication Hello, everyone, I’m wondering if anyone can help on   API?
I’m running example in the link, but getting errors like:

```"status":"error","message":"one or more associations are not valid","correlationId":"01ae623b-5574-xyz-9190d8810431","errors":[{"message":"0-2=4632101 is not a valid object","context":{"validationResult":["INVALID_FROM_OBJECT"]}}],"category":"BAD_REQUEST"}```
Here is my request:
4632101 is a contact ID
87 is an association to company, not contact
Where can I find mapping?
you need to send 81 I guess
<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v4/associations/communication/0-1/label>
So it's actually like this, just specify the object type you want to associate to using the objectType parameter
<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/schemas/communications>
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/analytics/events>
Thanks!
I think it’s working
I can't return a list of tags based on contentGroupId? You're killing me HubSpot

Hi everyone. I need to configure the headings and authenticate my POST request webhook, but I don’t see where I can do that using the automation workflow. Here’s the header information I need to add.

-- header ‘client_id: [value]’ \
-- header ‘client_secret’: [value]' \
-- header ‘Content-Type: application/json’

Ahh, I'm thinking about it and a line item can only have one association (Deal to Deal wise) or it moves between deals. Sounds like I just need to modify the JSON so it's more inputs instead, so each deal gets a new line item?

Hello friends, I hope you are doing well. I have a question, or rather, I’m unsure if I’m doing it correctly. The thing is, I want to retrieve all the fields, including the custom fields created in a workflow for a contact. Currently, I’m using the basic_api of HubSpot, but I’m not sure if there’s an advanced_api or something similar that would return even the custom fields created by me. This is my code:
```import os
from HubSpot import HubSpot
from HubSpot.crm.contacts import ApiException
def main(event):
	HubSpot = HubSpot(access_token=os.getenv('private_env'))
	api_response = HubSpot.crm.contacts.basic_api.get_by_id(contact_id="91351")
	print(api_response)
	return {
    	"outputFields": {
      	"msg": "ok"
    	}
	}```
Here is the response from it:

```{'archived': False,
'archived_at': None,
'associations': None,
'created_at': datetime.datetime(2023, 6, 16, 22, 53, 10, 403000, tzinfo=tzlocal()),
'id': '91351',
'properties': {'createdate': '2023-06-16T22:53:10.403Z',
'email': '<mailto:abelgr45@gmail.com|abelgr45@gmail.com>',
'firstname': 'Abel',
'hs_object_id': '91351',
'lastmodifieddate': '2023-07-17T19:18:48.634Z',
'lastname': 'Gonzalez'},
'properties_with_history': None,
'updated_at': datetime.datetime(2023, 7, 17, 19, 18, 48, 634000, tzinfo=tzlocal())}```

you should provide the list of properties you need as an argument: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts#:~:text=A%20comma%20separated%20list%20of%20the%20properties%20to%20be%20returned%20in%20the%20response|https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts#:~:text=A%20comma%20separated%20list%20of%20th[…]ies%20to%20be%20returned%20in%20the%20response>

I'm 90% certain that the batch update Line Item endpoint is broken in HubSpot API v3

`HubSpotClient.crm.lineItems.batchApi.update(batchInputSimplePublicObjectBatchInput);`

When I send my data via the method above, it gives me the error below (400 Unexpected Error). When I debug and manually convert the generated JS object to JSON and send it via the REST endpoint using Postman, however, the same exact object posts just fine. (201 Created)

`<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/line_items/batch/create|https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/line_items/batch/create>`

Full Error Received via batchApi.update is posted in this Reply Thread so I don't eat up the entire main thread. Here's the important part though:

```Uncaught ApiException Error: HTTP-Code: 400
Message: An error occurred.
Body: {"status":"error","message":"Invalid input JSON on line 1, column 191. Some required fields were not set: [id]" ...```
Excellent, thank you very much! I was able to accomplish what I needed.:handshake:

Hello to all! I need some help with a request that i'm doing via API to get infos from a deal pipeline in HubSpot. The problem is that there is a specific stage that doesn't return and when i filter only it, a error occurs. Forgive my lack of understanding, i'm a begginer in programing:

CODE:
"url = "<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/deals/search>"

headers = {
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Authorization": f"Bearer {access_token}"
}

def conectaAPI(after):
  data = {
      "limit": 100,
      "after": after,
      "properties": ['amount',  'closedate',  'createdate', 'dealname', 'dealstage', 'HubSpot_owner_id'],
      "filterGroups": [
          {
              "filters": [
                  {
                      "propertyName": "pipeline",
                      "operator": "EQ",
                      "value": id_pipeline_expansao
                  },
                  {
                      "propertyName": "closedate",
                      "operator": "BETWEEN",
                      "highValue": data_final,
                      "value": data_inicio
                  },
                  {
                      "propertyName": "dealstage",
                      "operator": "IN",
                      "values": ["82672997"]
                  },
              ]
          }
      ]
  }

  response = <http://requests.post|requests.post>(url, headers=headers, data=json.dumps(data))
  return response.json()

response = conectaAPI(None)
resultados = response['results']
total = response['total']
df = pd.DataFrame(resultados)
negocios = pd.DataFrame(df['properties'].tolist())"

Error:

```---------------------------------------------------------------------------
KeyError                                  Traceback (most recent call last)
/usr/local/lib/python3.10/dist-packages/pandas/core/indexes/base.py in get_loc(self, key, method, tolerance)
   3801             try:
-> 3802                 return self._engine.get_loc(casted_key)
   3803             except KeyError as err:```
